member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.IAppContainerTestContainer
member.summary: An for Windows Store app tests.
member.remarks:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- TODO: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This interface is pretty much unused at the moment. However, we can choose to make this interface public if we ever run across a case where an external consumer of needs to know path to the recipe file for a UWP test project. We think this scenario is very rare at the moment.
The for a UWP container matches the project output path (something.exe) for the corresponding project. Because most of our interactions (with Roslyn, code lens, project system, IVsSolution etc.) involve looking up containers and tests based on project output path, our internal data structures (TestContainerProvider, TestContainerRecord, TestCaseRecord etc.) operate primarily on project output path. However, test platform only knows about the recipe file (something.appxrecipe) for UWP tests. So whenever we need to interact with the test platform, we translate from the project output path to the recipe file (and vice-versa). For example, when we request test execution we map the project output path present in TestCaseRecord.Source to the recipe file and specify this recipe file in TestCase.Source. Similarly, when test platform tells us about discovered tests, we map the recipe file specified in TestCase.Source to the project output path and store this project output path in TestCaseRecord.Source.
In the rare case where an extension that consumes needs to interact with test platform (and also needs to support UWP test projects), the extension would need to do the same mapping from to . If we make public, this mapping can be performed by checking and casting the to to retrive the . --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.ICustomSettingsImporter
member.summary: Imports a custom settings file and returns a runsettings xml.
member.remarks: With runsettings having an extensible format to specify extension specific settings, there isn't a requirement to support multiple custom settings files. Extensions can always provide additional settings in IDE work flows through the IRunSettingsService.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.ICustomSettingsImporter.SettingsFileExtension
member.summary:
Extension of the settings file which need to be imported.
It should be non-null and should be valid file extension like ".mysettings".

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.ICustomSettingsImporter.Import(System.String,System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable)
member.summary: Imports the parameter settings file in the default runsettings.
member.param: Settings file which need to be imported. The file extension of the settings file will be specified by property.
Input RunSettings document to which settings file need to be imported.
member.returns: Updated RunSetting Xml document with imported settings.

member.summary: Returns a collection of file types which adapter can run/debug tests. This is optionally used in conjunction with to determine what exact test can be run. In the event where there's no ITestMethodResolver specified, all tests in the file will be run. Valid format is a dot followed by file extension. E.g. ".cs" represents a C# file.

member.summary: ï¼ŒInMemoryUnitTestWriter.cs This the int representation of a .

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.ITest.StalenessValue
member.summary: This the int representation of a Test whether it's currently CurrentlyBeingRun/IsNotStale/Stale The following are the possible values. 0 - Indicating TestData is currently running by the runner. Note that this means that the test is considered staled as well. 1 - Test is not stale. Indicating that test result has been received from the current run. 2 - Test is stale. Indicating that test is not being run in the current run operation or we have not yet received result for this test yet.
member.remarks: Please use or to determine staleness instead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.FilterMatchKind
member.remarks: The first three values need to directly correspond to the VS shell's __VSSEARCHFILTERTOKENTYPE enum.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.FilterMatchKind.MatchSubset
member.summary: If a property can have multiple values, this flag determines if the result match if any of the values matches (flag is off) or all values match the filter. In particular this ensures the special way that the table control filters items out. It specifies which items to exclude, even though for multi value properties it should only exclude properties which have their values as a subset of the search filter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.IVsTestService.IsServiceAvailable
member.summary: Indicates whether the test service is available to service test related operations.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.IVsTestService.OnReady
member.summary: Event fired when the test infrastructure is fully initialized and is ready to take test requests.
member.remarks: Fired typically when a solution/folder is opened.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.IVsTestService.OnInactive
member.summary: Event fired when the test infrastructure is no longer able to service test requests.
member.remarks: Fired typically when a solution/folder is closed.

member.returns: True if the operation is successful

member.summary: Debugs all tests that satisfy the specified filter.
member.returns: True if the operation is successful

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.IVsTestServiceInternal
member.summary: The primary reason this exists is so that we can support internal extensions like Code lens or Live Unit Testing without exposing too much to the external surface. We should be able to pull in APIs of interest from here to the external facing surface if there is a customer ask.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.IVsTestServiceInternal.RunLiveUnitTestsAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.TestQuery,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the latest LUT discovered tests that match a filter and runs them.
member.returns: True if the operation was successful
member.remarks: Although we do request to run/debug tests discovered by LUT, the store runner smartly determines if we can find a full fidelity Assembly Based Test with the same test case id and if so, runs that instead. This test is expected to be up-to-date because we perform a discovery before the run operation. If we do not find one we end up running the low fidelity LUT test by name instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.IVsTestServiceInternal.DebugLiveUnitTestsAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.TestQuery,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the latest LUT discovered tests that match a filter and debugs them.
member.returns: True if the operation was successful
member.remarks: Although we do request to run/debug tests discovered by LUT, the store runner smartly determines if we can find a full fidelity Assembly Based Test with the same test case id and if so, runs that instead. This test is expected to be up-to-date because we perform a discovery before the run operation. If we do not find one we end up running the low fidelity LUT test by name instead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.TestState
member.summary: State of the last result from a test run
member.remarks: Be careful when changing this enum. The order of these enum values is also the order they are displayed in the UI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.TestState.None
member.summary: Indicates the test has no state yet.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.TestState.Failed
member.summary: Indicates that the test has failed

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.TestState.Skipped
member.summary: Indicates that the test has skipped

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.TestState.Passed
member.summary: Indicates that the test has passed

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.TestState.NotFound
member.summary: Indicates that the test cannot be found.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Extensibility.TestState.NotRun
member.summary: Indicates that the test has not been run
